title: What will be the most valuable job skills as a result of climate change? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hm. Tough one. The jobs created by climate change directly are not easy to think of but seem obvious in hindsight. Arborists and gardeners, who know how to adapt a garden to a different climate.Biologists, to work on saving species that are freshly endangered by changing habitats.Engineers, to build sturdier buildings that can stand up to a Cat 5 hurricane every few years.Makers of rescue equipment and emergency supplies.Everything in renewable energy: solar power, wind turbine engineers and technicians and manufacturers.Above all, critical thinking skills and ability to adapt to new facts. Ability to convince your prospective employer that you aren’t brainwashed and aren’t an idiot. Or to cope, if your boss turns out to be brainwashed or an idiot.
As a chemical engineer, having the skills to review the data. Determining there is no proof of man made climate change, no matter how loudly the media and politicians scream it.
